unnormalised: ## Kooda Kachra: Let's Talk Waste Management, Yaar!
normalised: ## Kooda Kachra: Let us Talk Waste Management, Yaar!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Let's get real for a minute about something we all contribute to, whether we like it or not: waste! Yeah, kooda kachra, that mountain of stuff we throw away every single day. From the discarded chai cups at your local tapri to the wedding leftovers after Meena Aunty's daughter's shaadi in Delhi, it all adds up.
normalised: Hey everyone! Let us get real for a minute about something we all contribute to, whether we like it or not: waste! Yeah, kooda kachra, that mountain of stuff we throw away every single day. From the discarded chai cups at your local tapri to the wedding leftovers after Meena Aunty's daughter's shaadi in Delhi, it all adds up.

unnormalised: And in a country like India, with our crazy population and booming economy, waste management is a HUGE deal. We're talking about mountains of plastic choking our rivers like the Yamuna, landfills overflowing near cities like Bangalore, and the general feeling of "arey yaar, what can we do?"
normalised: And in a country like India, with our crazy population and booming economy, waste management is a huge deal. We are talking about mountains of plastic choking our rivers like the Yamuna, landfills overflowing near cities like Bangalore, and the general feeling of "arey yaar, what can we do?"

unnormalised: But honestly, we CAN do something. Remember that Swachh Bharat Abhiyan campaign launched on 02/10/2014? It was a good start! But it's not just about sweeping the streets, it's about what happens to all that swept-up stuff afterwards.
normalised: But honestly, we can do something. Remember that Swachh Bharat Abhiyan campaign launched on second October two thousand and fourteen? It was a good start! But it is not just about sweeping the streets, it is about what happens to all that swept-up stuff afterwards.

unnormalised: Think about it – composting your vegetable peels instead of tossing them in the bin. Supporting local artisans who use recycled materials to make those cool jholas you see at Dilli Haat. Even just making sure you separate your dry and wet waste like the BMC in Mumbai keeps telling us to do! It’s the small things that add up.
normalised: Think about it – composting your vegetable peels instead of tossing them in the bin. Supporting local artisans who use recycled materials to make those cool jholas you see at Dilli Haat. Even just making sure you separate your dry and wet waste like the B M C in Mumbai keeps telling us to do! It is the small things that add up.

unnormalised: Places like Auroville are showing us how community-based waste management can work wonders. Imagine if every mohalla in India embraced that spirit!
normalised: Places like Auroville are showing us how community-based waste management can work wonders. Imagine if every mohalla in India embraced that spirit!

unnormalised: We need better systems for collecting and processing waste, sure. The IIT Kharagpur is even researching innovative ways to convert waste into energy! But the biggest change has to come from us, individually. Next time you're about to toss something, take a second. Can it be recycled? Can it be reused? Can you avoid buying it in the first place?

unnormalised: Let's all try to be a little more mindful about our kooda. Remember, even Gandhiji said cleanliness is next to Godliness! Maybe, just maybe, by 15/08/2047 (100 years of Independence!), we can be a much cleaner, greener India. Let's aim for a zero waste Diwali by 09:00 hrs next year, shall we? Every little bit helps!
